discussion.author: IanButterworth
discussion.text:
Yeah, it does feel a bit against the system and could easily clash in namespace with wrapped lib objects.

Options that have come up so far

1. PNG, JPEG,  TIFF
2. Png, Jpeg, Tiff
3. PNGFiles, JPEGFiles, TIFFFiles
4. PngFiles, JpegFiles, TiffFiles
5. PNGImageIO, JPEGImageIO, TIFFImageIO
6. PNGIO, JPEGIO, TIFFIO
7. PngIO, JpegIO, TiffIO
8. PortableNetworkGraphicsFiles, JointPhotographicExpertsGroupFiles, TaggedImageFileFormatFiles
9.  PNGImages, JPEGImages, TIFFImages
10. LibPNG, LibJPEG, LibTIFF

There is some precedence and logic for PNGFiles given CSVFiles. I don't love how that looks though.
I'm torn between PNGFiles, PngFiles, PngIO

discussion.author: johnnychen94
discussion.text:
> When we get there, TIFFFiles is a little awkward, but I doubt it will spoil anyones fun.

I thought there will be a wrapper package `ImageIO` for all of these so that users don't need to install each one individually.  If so the slightly lengthy name won't cause any inconvenience for general users.

discussion.author: IanButterworth
discussion.text:
Where we settled was to not have the `ImageIO` wrapper, because it would've negatively impacted load time as it grew in format support, which seems counter to the FileIO architecture and unhelpful given that typical usage is to use one image format at a time. Also, we're keeping ImageMagick and QuartzImageIO as backup, so this would be opt-in, at least initially.

I've now renamed to https://github.com/JuliaIO/PNGFiles.jl

discussion.author: IanButterworth
discussion.text: But then again, the ImageIO layer could be a lazy-loader, and just handle the installation of the deps.. That hadn't occurred to me
